name: Atlantean Cottage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had to change our dates the very last min. due to family member illness. Gary and Heidi could not have been nicer to accommondate us. The B&B is very tastefuly decorated and we just loved our stay. I wish we had found this place sooner. This is a place we will definitely return.
reviews.title: will definitely return!
A luxurious home away from home
reviews.text: We arrived in Bar Harbour at the end of May looking for somewhere nice to stay for 2 nights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: By chance we happened upon the Atlantean Inn and I am so glad we did!
reviews.title: Best B and B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the nicest place we stayed in on our trip up north from boston.
reviews.title: Can't wait to return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Gary and Heidi were very welcoming and encouraged us to make ourselves at home whilst we stayed with them.
reviews.title: Would definitely go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall Inn: impeccably clean; very well maintained. Very cozy and exactly as it appears on the web site. Delicious homemeade cookies awaited us in our room on arrival! The butler pantry was well stocked, and we were always welcome to help ourselves to coffee, tea, cocoa, biscotti, etc.
reviews.title: The Perfect B & B

reviews.text: Innkeepers: Heidi and Gary are warm, inviting, friendly and attentive. They are a magnificent couple who obviously enjoy what they do. Their dogs are cute too and very well behaved!
reviews.title: Very good at what it does.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: (Edgemere) Looks exactly as pictured on the web site. Very comfortable king size bed. Modern bathroom with whirlpool tub and separate shower and radiant floor heat. Very tastefully decorated. We had a fire in the fireplace during each of our two nights--a great touch! A truly beautiful room( --plus it was toasty warm without drafts in the dead of winter.)
reviews.title: The Best of Bar Harbor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food: Delicious with very generous portions. Wonderful fruits in the middle of winter for the first course and sinfully tasty gourmet main dishes. The high quality of the breakfasts is not emphasized enough on the web site. Magnificent!
reviews.title: Best kept secret in Bar Harbor

likes.liked: — Inn location and the Chatswold room were both excellent

reviews.text: Overall: Five Stars! Loved it. We will definitely return here and will recommend it to everyone we know.
reviews.title: Well worth the drive from Long Island!

likes.liked: — The suite and common room accomodations - plenty of room

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at the Atlantean for a girls weekend away in August and it was wonderful. The inn is beautifully maintained. We had a room with double beds (very comfortable) and a GREAT shower! We liked being able to walk around town and it is close to the shore walk as well. It was on a quiet side street and the innkeepers were very knowledgeable. Gary will warn you of the significant number of tourists in certain places in the park (Acadia), but that goes with the territory. It's a very popular place in the summer. Being from Maine, we are well accustomed to it! And it was bearable :) Breakfast was good, although not quite to our particular liking. Very good restaurants nearby: Havana, Cafe This Way. And you have to stop at the Trenton Bridge Lobster Pound for lobster (unless you don't like lobster)!! Just not on Sunday, when they are closed. Bar Harbor & Acadia (specifically Southwest Harbor and Seal Harbor) are great places to hang out and hike in the summer and early fall.
reviews.title: Lovely inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent four nights here and thought this was a first-rate, professional operation. The house and grounds provided the perfect backdrop for our first Maine vacation. We travel a lot and were looking for an inn-type property rather than a mom-and-pop set-up and the Atlantean really came through.
reviews.title: A Class Act

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in the Mizzentop suite, which was wonderful. It consisted of a bedroom, lounge/tv room, second bedroom with a day bed and a fabulous bathroom. To start, the bathroom was fit for a king—with a raised platform Jacuzzi tub and big windows it was really a fabulous place to soak after a hike in Acadia. The second bedroom was a great place for an afternoon read as the daybed was directly below a huge skylight. We really liked having the tv lounge as it gave you room to spread out and somewhere else to sit besides the bed. There was ample room for luggage. The room, as well as the entire inn, was immaculately clean—no dusty knickknacks here, no thrift store bric a brac. At one point I dropped an earring on the floor and had to get it from under the bed—you could have eaten breakfast on that floor. The room looks exactly like the photos on the website.
reviews.title: Had a great time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The public areas of the inn consisted of the foyer, parlor, breakfast room, butler’s pantry and garden and porch. All were elegantly decorated. In the pantry hosts Gary and Heidi provide snacks of all types, bottled water and a fridge for guests. There are thick books of local information compiled for guests and Gary presided over the breakfast room every morning answering questions and providing suggestions for the day’s activities. Both Gary and Heidi were unfailingly helpful and professional.
reviews.title: Fell in love with the Atlantean!

likes.liked: — The cleanliness of the B&B as well as the delicious breakfasts!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfasts consisted of a fruit dish and a hot entrée. Most were very good—the pineapple French toast in particular. We did have one clunker though (sorry Gary—ditch the Acadian pie). The white chocolate chip oatmeal cookies they put out in the afternoon are to die for. I really had to discipline myself.
reviews.title: Loved our stay

likes.liked: — Room appointment and location of Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the Atlantean. The location was great - on a quiet street right near the center of Bar Harbor. Our room was romantic - with wood floors, a fire place and queen estate bed with wooden headboard. Heidi and Gary were very friendly and made us feel at home. They served yummy cookies in the late afternoon. The breakfast was delicious. The next time we go to Bar Harbor we are going to stay here.
reviews.title: We enjoyed our stay at the Atlantean

likes.liked: — Warm, friendly atmosphere & room was romatinc

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wife and I thoroughly enjoyed this Inn. We would not look for any other place to stay in Bar Harbor. Great atmosphere, great location, great property. Great innkeepers.
reviews.title: Ideal place to stay

likes.liked: — The Inn itself and the innkeepers
likes.disliked: — Parking space if I had to choose.

reviews.text: We can confirm the other glowing reviews of this property and the innkeepers. The real reason to stay here may be the location - a beautiful and quiet street just a couple of blocks from all the shops and restaurants in Bar Harbor. Many of the other inns and hotels that you may be considering are on busy main streets or outside of town. The inn itself was also very quiet - other than at breakfast, it seemed that we were the only ones there, despite all 8 rooms being occupied for our four night stay. Gary and Heidi were great sources of local information, helping us avoid the summer crowds.
reviews.title: No Need to Look Anywhere Else

likes.liked: — Quiet location, quiet inn, great innkeepers, beautiful house

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While our stay was not entirely unpleasant, this business snuck an additional charge for one of the nights we reserved... We had problems with our flight to Maine and could not arrive until the second evening. We notified the inn as soon as possible, and were then informed that we would lose our 50% deposit. When we arrived, the innkeepers took advantage of the circumstances and charged the full amount instead (for the night we missed).
reviews.title: Slippery and

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since we stayed four nights at a nondiscounted rate, it would've been reasonable for Atlantean Inn to waive the fees for one night, or to withhold our 50% deposit for the night we missed, instead of charging the full amount.. However, these inkeepers are unreasonable and are unwilling to work with their customers.
reviews.title: Most beautiful B&B in Bar Harbor!

likes.liked: — Cleanliness, interior design, friendly innkeepers, privacy of room, comfort, breakfast, sightseeing advice.

description: Atlantean Cottage is the name given to this lovely Tudor cottage, the personal residence of renowned Bar Harbor architect Frederick Savage. You'll find no more tranquil, quiet locale so very close to the best restaurants, galleries, museums, and shops. On a peaceful lane between Main Street and the ocean lies this serene getaway just around the corner from all that Bar Harbor Village has to offer.
